intro: Tournefortia tetrandra var. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 3 meters, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white or yellowish flowers, which bloom in the summer months. Its flowers are characterized by four stamens, giving it the specific epithet "tetrandra." The plant is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments.
